abstract: In a new column for the Moment blog, Lynn Yaeger peeks at people's terrifically odd, amusing and magnificent collections, starting with the robot menagerie of the photographer Mary Ellen Mark.
snippet: In a new column for the Moment blog, Lynn Yaeger peeks at people's terrifically odd, amusing and magnificent collections, starting with the robot menagerie of the photographer Mary Ellen Mark.
lead_paragraph: In a new column, Lynn Yaeger peeks at people's terrifically odd, amusing and magnificent collections, starting with the robot menagerie of the photographer Mary Ellen Mark. "Their batteries have probably all melted. I'm a bad robot mom," Ms. Mark said, looking with wry affection at the crowd of robots - pink fembots in frilly aprons! Mean metal guys with clock bellies! - that have taken up residence in her downtown loft, a place that has been her studio since almost before SoHo was SoHo. Read more (and view photos) on T Magazine's Moment blog.

headline.main: Mary Ellen Mark and the Robots
